fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:fullName: ISO/IEC 10918-1:1994. Information technology -- Digital compression and coding of continuous-tone still images, baseline DCT sequential (formal name); Baseline JPEG (common name)

fdd:description.p: Lossy compression encoding for full color and grayscale continuous-tone images that employs discrete cosine transforms (DCT) and other processes. In baseline encoding, the 8-by-8 pixel Minimum Coded Unit (MCU) blocks that comprise the image are input sequentially; the coefficients of a single block are encoded in a zigzag manner. When decoded, the image appears from top to bottom like a windowshade rolling down. Compression is variable and governed by a number of parameters; typical settings provide from 10:1 to 20:1 reductions in file size. See also JPEG.
JPEG_DCT_BL has been assigned PRONOM PUID: x-cmp/11.

fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:shortDescription: Lossy compression algorithm for full color and grayscale continuous-tone images that employs discrete cosine transforms (DCT) and other processes. In baseline encoding, the 8-by-8 pixel Minimum Coded Unit (MCU) blocks that comprise the image are input sequentially; the coefficients of a single block are encoded in a zigzag manner.
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:productionPhase: May be applied in initial-state picture creation; often used for middle- and final-state archiving or end-user delivery.

fdd:relationship.fdd:comment: JFIF File Interchange Format, Versions 1.00 and 1.01, not described at this Web site at this time

fdd:relatedTo.fdd:titleName: JPEG Encoded File with Exif Metadata

fdd:relationship.fdd:comment: JTIF File Format, a variant of TIFF, not described at this Web site at this time

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:disclosure: Fully disclosed. Developed by the Joint Photographic Experts Group (JPEG), formally known as ISO/IEC JTC 1/SC 29/WG 10.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:documentation: ISO/IEC 10918-1:1994. Information technology -- Digital compression and coding of continuous-tone still images: Requirements and guidelines. Same as ITU-T Rec. T.81:1992.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:transparency: Depends upon algorithms and tools to read; will require sophistication to build tools.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:selfDocumentation: See the file format descriptions for JFIF_1_02, SPIFF, and JPEG_EXIF.

fdd:stillImageQF.fdd:clarity: Good, but source data is limited to 8-bits-per-channel. Quality varies according to the sophistication of the encoding and the degree of compression applied. Most commentators agree that, at the same compression ratios, discrete cosine transforms (DCT) produce less clarity than discrete wavelet tranforms (DWT), used by J2K_C (JPEG 2000) and other compression algorithms.
fdd:stillImageQF.fdd:colorMaint: See the file format descriptions for JFIF_1_02, SPIFF, and JPEG_EXIF.
fdd:stillImageQF.fdd:beyondImage: Not investigated for this format description.

fdd:magicNumbers.fdd:note: Start of Image (SOI) marker; see also JPEG

fdd:other.fdd:tag: Indicator for profile, level, version, etc.

fdd:values.fdd:note: Start of Frame (SOF) marker for baseline sequential DCT; see also JPEG

fdd:citation.fdd:specReference: ISO/IEC 10918-1:1994. Information technology -- Digital compression and coding of continuous-tone still images: Requirements and guidelines
ITU-T Rec. T.81:1992. Information technology – Digital compression and coding of continuous-tone still images: Requirements and guidelines (same as ISO/IEC 10918-1)

fdd:urlReference.tag: Image Optimization, Part 4: Progressive JPEG…Hot or Not?
fdd:urlReference.comment: 2008 blog by Stoyan Stefanov, compares progressive and baseline.

fdd:urlReference.tag: PRONOM entry for Baseline JPEG encoding/compression.

fdd:urlGroup.fdd:intro: See also the references cited in JPEG.
